segments.text: I see the woman drying dishes, completely focused on her task.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She doesn’t even seem to notice the water pouring out of the sink.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is standing on that stool, reaching for the cookies like it’s the most important thing in the world.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is just waiting, her hand outstretched, hoping for a treat.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think the stool is about to tip over, and no one is doing anything about it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is just flowing and flowing, making the floor slippery and dangerous.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The garden outside looks so calm, like nothing is wrong at all.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if the woman will ever turn around and see what’s happening.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The whole scene feels like it’s about to fall apart at any moment.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe no one has noticed the mess yet.
segments.speaker: PAR
